newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAD sees 15 pct earnings growth in 1996/97.
newsitem.headline: SAD sees 15 pct earnings growth in 1996/97.

text.p: South African Druggists Ltd (SAD) was expected to achieve a 15 percent growth in earnings in the 1996/97 financial year despite tough industry conditions, Peter Beningfield, the chief executive said on Tuesday.
He said although the pharmaceutical and healthcare industry was likely to remain in a state of turmoil in the year ahead, SAD was well positioned to benefit from the anticipated changes.
"The shift to generics...is inevitable given government's firm commitment to reducing the cost of medication," he said.
"SAD has long been the local leader in generics...(and we) are well equipped to compete with international manufacturers."
He said continuing cost-reduction pressures would lead to the increased use of SAD's multi-disciplinary Medicross clinics, which would boost the healthcare division's profitability.

Strong results from the group's offshore operations and the fact that all products currently in development would be capable of getting European registration, augured well for the group's international activities.
"Barring the unforeseen, we therefore expect to achieve our EPS growth target of 15 percent in the coming year," Beningfield said.
